thread.title: 49ers Fire Chip Kelly After Going 2-14 On Season
thread.title_full: 49ers Fire Chip Kelly After Going 2-14 On Season

author: CBS Philly
title: 49ers Fire Chip Kelly After Going 2-14 On Season
text:
49ers Fire Chip Kelly After Going 2-14 On Season January 1, 2017 9:49 PM ATLANTA, GA - DECEMBER 18: Head coach Chip Kelly of the San Francisco 49ers looks on during the first half against the Atlanta Falcons at the Georgia Dome on December 18, 2016 in Atlanta, Georgia. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — Former Eagles head coach Chip Kelly has been released as head coach of the San Francisco 49ers. Chip was hired by the 49ers in 2016 after being fired by the Eagles at the end of last season. 49ers relieve both Trent Baalke and Chip Kelly of their duties: https://t.co/BVCDa4gpOu pic.twitter.com/tsw0r1eqQa 
— San Francisco 49ers (@49ers) January 2, 2017 
The 49ers went just 2-14 and finished in last place in the NFC West. 49ers officially have informed Chip Kelly he no longer is their coach, per source. 
— Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 2, 2017 
The Niners will have the second overall draft pick in the 2017 NFL Draft in Philadelphia.
